text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is Glenn Atlanta support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Johannesburg South Africa today I'll be
showing you how you can troubleshoot
unknown error attempting to reach for an
error from SMS in Amazon simple
notification service let's get started
first let's inspect the logs open the
Amazon Cloud watch logs
choose lock groups on the left menu bar
let's filter the logs by entering direct
publish to phone number
select the failure log group and open
the lock screen
as you can see the SMS failed due to an
unknown error
this data might be caused by multiple
residency to how SMS is distributed
let's take a look at few of those
reasons
the first step is to check for command
issues listed here by looking at the
list we can identify the cost of the
failure by cross-referencing the errors
the state and the state of the device
and content of the message
preview SMS best practices avoid sending
about messages or unsolicit messages and
follow the rules and regulation for the
destination country or AWS regions when
you send your SMS messages
if the issue is related to a single
number then validate the phone number
using the Amazon pinpoint validator
from the response we can tell that the
error was due to an invalid phone number
because this is an invalid phone number
SNS failed to deliver the SMS to the
endpoint
if the phone number is valid try sending
a message from another device and
confirm that is successful if the issue
persists it's best practice for the
device owner to contact their mobile
carrier for support
finally if the issue is affecting
multiple devices it might be a control
specific issue we can cross check the
supported countries listed in our
documentation
depending on the origination identities
that you have said an SMS can fail with
this error G2
country not supporting sender ID and
registered sender ID
and registered URL
if you are still facing the issues after
running the troubleshooting steps
explained there might be an issue with
Downstream aggregators suppliers and
careers therefore to troubleshoot the
potential Downstream issues create an
AWS support case and provide the
following information in your support
case
the region that you are using to send
SMS messages
a timestamp of when the issue started
sample of the SMS Logs with message IDs
of failed SMS messages to at least three
or four different numbers not older than
three days
please note generally mobile carriers
don't store SMS information for more
than three days
so now you know how you can troubleshoot
unknown errors attempting to reach for
an error from SMS in Amazon's and post
notification service thanks for watching
and happy cloud computing from all of us
here at AWS
foreign
[Music]
[Music]
